text.text: Chilesaurus, a small ornithoscelida from Chile in the Uper Jurassic Toqui Formation. A mix of many taxonomy, including that of theropods, ornithischians, and sauropodomorphs, this little dinosaur is and oddity in paleontology. First confirmed discovery in 2004, described in 2015, the Chilesaurus has been place in many taxonomy.
Chilesaurus was 3.2 meters from nose to tail, around the size of a dog. It would've eaten smaller plants along the ground, though the teeth are that of a sterotypical theropod.
